intro: Agylla ensifolia, commonly known as the swordleaf agylla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow leaves that resemble a sword, hence its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Agylla ensifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
